name: SE.Framework.Breadcrumb

values.name: activeLink
values.comment: Creates an active link. It takes the url as the first parameter and the a list of html content as the second.

values.name: breadcrumb
values.comment: This function takes a list of Link tags (created via the link function or activeLink function). We only support the / separator, left alignment and normal size.

values.name: link
values.comment: Creates a non-active link. It takes the url as the first parameter and the a list of html content as the second.

name: SE.Framework.Buttons

unions.name: Modifier
unions.comment: Modify the button, support all modifiers in Bulma except the Disabled. To disable a button, use `Nothing` as the Maybe msg.

values.name: button
values.comment:
A reusable button which has some styles pre-applied to it.
If onPress is Nothing, then the button will show as disabled
values.type: List.List SE.Framework.Buttons.Modifier -> Maybe.Maybe msg -> List.List (Html.Styled.Html msg) -> Html.Styled.Html msg

values.name: buttons
values.type: List.List SE.Framework.Buttons.ButtonsModifier -> List.List (Html.Styled.Html msg) -> Html.Styled.Html msg

name: SE.Framework.Colors

values.name: backgroundActive
values.comment: The color used when background is "active" (i.e. clicked).

values.name: backgroundHover
values.comment: The color used when background is hovered.

values.name: base
values.comment: Base grey, not used a lot.

values.name: black
values.comment: The "black" color (it's not entirely black) is used as a text color when the background is not white or to emphasis text.

values.name: callToAction
values.comment: Orange call to action, in example a buy button

values.name: callToActionActive
values.comment: The color used when call to action is "active" (i.e. clicked).

values.name: callToActionHover
values.comment: The color used when call to action is hovered.

values.name: danger
values.comment: A red hue indicating an error.

values.name: dangerActive
values.comment: The color used when danger is "active" (i.e. clicked).

values.name: dangerHover
values.comment: The color used when danger is hovered.

values.name: dark
values.comment: Dark grey, not used a lot.

values.name: darker
values.comment: The darker grey can be used to de-emphasis text.

values.name: info
values.comment: The info color a lighter blue than link, it's used for notifications and messages.

values.name: infoActive
values.comment: The color used when info is "active" (i.e. clicked).

values.name: infoHover
values.comment: The color used when info is hovered.

values.name: light
values.comment: The light shade functions as the regular border color.

values.name: lighter
values.comment: The lighter shade is used as a hover color for `lightest`.

values.name: lightest
values.comment: The lightest shade of gray, used as background to make something pop from the regular white background.

values.name: linkActive
values.comment: The color used when links are active.

values.name: linkHover
values.comment: The color used when links are hovered.

values.name: primary
values.comment: Our primary green color, the same color is used as the "success" color.

values.name: primaryActive
values.comment: The color used when primary is "active" (i.e. clicked).

values.name: primaryHover
values.comment: The color used when primary is hovered.

values.name: success
values.comment:
Alias for primary.

In Bulma, success is a bright green color to express a success result of an action like "Saved!" or "Item #123 placed in the basket.". Since our primary color is green, we use primary and success interchangeably.

values.name: warning
values.comment: An orange hue. Warning indicates something that the user should be alerted about. It's not as heavy as "danger".

values.name: warningActive
values.comment: The color used when warning is "active" (i.e. clicked).

values.name: warningHover
values.comment: The color used when warning is hovered.

name: SE.Framework.Columns
comment:
Bulmas Columns
see <https://bulma.io/documentation/columns/>


# Basics

Too a large extend, these functions works very similar a Bulmas own version. Each container modifier is its own function. The `.is-mobile` modifier isn't needed since the `Sizes` type contains a mobile option. Instead of variable gap, we have 3 different gap widths, small (0.5 rem), normal (0.75 rem) and wide (1 rem).

@docs columns, multilineColumns, gaplessColumns, smallColumns, gaplessMultilineColumns, smallMultilineColumns, wideColumns, wideMultilineColumns


# Column

There are 2 different column functions. `defaultColumn` is the standard, no options alternative, if you just want the plain .column class.

@docs defaultColumn, column


# Sizes

The `column` function takes a `Sizes` parameter, a List (Device, Width)

@docs Sizes, Device, Width


# Unsupported features

  - .is-vcentered
  - .is-centered
  - .is-variable and .is-2-mobile etc.

unions.name: Device
unions.comment: The devices we support. `All` sets the width without a mediaquery.

unions.name: Width
unions.comment: A lot of the width modifiers for `column` is supported.

aliases.name: Sizes
aliases.comment:
Combine different `Width` options with a `Device` like this:

    [ ( All, OneThird )
    , ( Mobile, Half )
    ]
        == ".is-one-third .is-half-mobile"

values.name: column
values.comment:
`.column` with Sizes options columns [ defaultColumn [ text "Default column" ] , column [ ( All, Half ) , ( Mobile, OneThird ) ] [ text "Half width column that shrinks to one third on a mobile device" ] ] == "
\n
Default column
\n
Half width column that shrinks to one third on a mobile device
\n
"

name: SE.Framework.Container
comment:
Bulmas container tag
see <https://bulma.io/documentation/layout/container/>


# Definition

@docs container, Modifier

unions.name: Modifier
unions.comment: For now, only Fluid modifier is supported

values.name: container
values.comment:
A simple container to center your content horizontally
Only support the Fluid modifier, no is-widescreen or similar.
values.type: List.List SE.Framework.Container.Modifier -> List.List (Html.Styled.Html msg) -> Html.Styled.Html msg

name: SE.Framework.Content
comment:
Bulmas content element
see <https://bulma.io/documentation/elements/content/>


# Definition

@docs content

values.name: content
values.comment:
Styles most HTML tags -

paragraphs -

      lists -

      to

      headings -
      quotes - and -
      tables Works like a normal Html.Styled.div: content [] [ h1 [] [ text "Heading 1" ] , p [] [ text "Content body text" ] ]
values.type: List.List (Html.Styled.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Styled.Html msg) -> Html.Styled.Html msg

name: SE.Framework.Control
comment:
Helper functions for form elements and buttons.

@docs controlHeight, controlStyle, Size

unions.name: Size
unions.comment: Form input controls and buttons use this type as an argument to their Size Modifier

values.name: controlHeight
values.comment: Height used for controls like buttons and text inputs.

values.name: controlStyle
values.comment: "Normalized" style for controls like buttons and input text fields.

name: SE.Framework.Delete
comment:
Bulmas delete tag
see <https://bulma.io/documentation/elements/delete/>


# Definition

@docs delete

values.name: delete
values.comment:
A simple circle with a cross, no support for sizes.
You can supply custom styles with the first argument.

name: SE.Framework.Dropdown
comment:
Bulmas Dropdown component
see <https://bulma.io/documentation/components/dropdown/>

The Elm Arcitecture makes it a little difficult to listen to clicks on the entire document. Instead we use the OuterClick utility library to know if the user has clicked outside of the dropdown.


# Unsupported features

  - Hoverable
  - Right aligned
  - Drop up


# Definition

@docs dropdown


# Button

@docs button


# Content

@docs link, content, hr

values.name: button
values.comment:
The dropdown button, toggles open/closed
see the button component for more documentation on the modifiers
values.type: List.List SE.Framework.Buttons.Modifier -> Maybe.Maybe msg -> List.List (Html.Styled.Html msg) -> SE.Framework.Dropdown.Button msg

values.name: dropdown
values.comment:
Render the dropdown
Parameters

1.  String id for the dropdown, should be unique in order to support multiple dropdowns on the same page
2.  Close message
3.  Bool isOpen
4.  A button created via the `button` function
5.  A list of Items created via `link`, `content` or `hr`
values.type: String.String -> msg -> Basics.Bool -> SE.Framework.Dropdown.Button msg -> List.List (SE.Framework.Dropdown.Item msg) -> Html.Styled.Html msg

name: SE.Framework.Form
comment:
Bulmas Form elements
see <https://bulma.io/documentation/form/>


# General

@docs label, input, textarea, select, checkbox, radio, number, date, email, password, tel


# Input Record and Modifiers

@docs InputModifier, InputRecord, NumberRecord, TextareaRecord, SelectRecord, Option, PasswordRecord, PasswordAutocomplete


# Fields and Controls

@docs field, FieldModifier, control, expandedControl


# Unsupported features

  - Horizontal form
  - Size modifier (for some elements)
  - .help
  - icons in input, textarea, select .control

aliases.name: InputRecord
aliases.comment: Holds the basic data for inputs, textareas and selects
aliases.type: { value : String.String, placeholder : String.String, modifiers : List.List SE.Framework.Form.InputModifier, onInput : String.String -> msg }

aliases.name: NumberRecord
aliases.comment: Number field has range and step as well
aliases.type: { a | range : ( Basics.Float, Basics.Float ), step : Basics.Float }

aliases.name: Option
aliases.comment: label and value properties for the <option> tag

aliases.name: PasswordRecord
aliases.comment: Password fields has an autocomplete property that can hint at the browser what kind is password field it is. That way the browser can suggest new passwords or the current password depending on the situation.

aliases.name: SelectRecord
aliases.comment: Selects also need a rows attribute

aliases.name: TextareaRecord
aliases.comment: Textareas also need a rows attribute

values.name: checkbox
values.comment:
The checkbox depart from Bulma, instead we use a styled span to get a "better looking" checkbox.
TODO checkbox does not support modifiers, should it?

values.name: control
values.comment:
`div.control` control False [] == "
" control True [] == "
"

values.name: expandedControl
values.comment:
`div.control.is-expanded` expandedControl False [] == "
" expandedControl True [] == "
"

values.name: field
values.comment:
`div.field` field [] [ text "Field" ] == "
Field
" field [ Attached ] [ text "Attached field" ] = "
Attached field
" field [ Grouped ] [ text "Grouped field" ] = "
Grouped field
"
values.type: List.List SE.Framework.Form.FieldModifier -> List.List (Html.Styled.Html msg) -> Html.Styled.Html msg

values.name: radio
values.comment:
The radio depart from Bulma, instead we use a styled span to get a "better looking" radio.
TODO radio does not support modifiers, should it?

name: SE.Framework.Icon
comment:
Creates a Bulma Icon element set.

We use more or less the same styles for the icon container but We use plain inline svgs for icons instead of FontAwesome. This gives us the flexibility and speed that we want (FontAwesome is a 500kb js file to begin with).

<https://bulma.io/documentation/elements/icon/>


# Available icons

@docs bargain, bid, box, boxes, campaign, cart, dolly, ethernet, eye, facebook, history, home, images, lightbulb, linkedin, new, notification, pdf, phone, satelliteDish, table, th, thLarge, thList, trash, truck, tv, user, wifi

values.name: table
values.comment: Custom icon to mediate a tight product view table

name: SE.Framework.Image

values.name: image
values.comment:
Create and img tag with a list of sources. If the list of sources is empty or hasn't got a single source with the resolution of 1, then this function will output an empty text tag. image ( 640, 480 ) [ source "https://bulma.io/images/placeholders/640x480.png" 1 , source "https://bulma.io/images/placeholders/1280x960.png" 2 ] == "
"
values.type: ( SE.Framework.Image.Width, SE.Framework.Image.Height ) -> List.List SE.Framework.Image.Source -> Html.Styled.Html msg

values.name: noImage
values.comment: Image placeholder when image is missing

values.name: source
values.comment:
Create a source with a url and a resolution (1,2,3)
Read more about the srcset attribute at <https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/HTML/Multimedia_and_embedding/Responsive_images>

    source "https://bulma.io/images/placeholders/640x480.png" 1

name: SE.Framework.Level
comment:
Bulmas level component
see <https://bulma.io/documentation/layout/level/>

This module is divided levels and items.


# Levels

@docs level, mobileLevel, centeredLevel


# Item

@docs item

values.name: level
values.comment: Takes 2 lists of `item`, the first will be left-aligned, the second right-aligned
values.type: List.List (SE.Framework.Level.Item msg) -> List.List (SE.Framework.Level.Item msg) -> Html.Styled.Html msg

values.name: mobileLevel
values.comment: Same as the standard level, except that the level will maintain its horizontal layout on mobile size.
values.type: List.List (SE.Framework.Level.Item msg) -> List.List (SE.Framework.Level.Item msg) -> Html.Styled.Html msg

Bulmas modal component
see <https://bulma.io/documentation/components/modal/>


# Definition

@docs modal

values.name: modal
values.comment: The modal does not have an active state, to close the modal, simple don't render it.

name: SE.Framework.Notification
comment:
Bulmas notification element
see <https://bulma.io/documentation/elements/notification/>


# Definition

This module exposes one function for each color. If you supply a message it will be triggered if the user clicks the delete button. If no message is supplied, no delete button will be displayed.

@docs notification, primary, link, info, success, warning, danger

values.name: danger
values.type: Maybe.Maybe msg -> List.List (Html.Styled.Html msg) -> Html.Styled.Html msg

values.name: info
values.type: Maybe.Maybe msg -> List.List (Html.Styled.Html msg) -> Html.Styled.Html msg

values.name: link
values.type: Maybe.Maybe msg -> List.List (Html.Styled.Html msg) -> Html.Styled.Html msg

values.name: notification
values.type: Maybe.Maybe msg -> List.List (Html.Styled.Html msg) -> Html.Styled.Html msg

values.name: primary
values.type: Maybe.Maybe msg -> List.List (Html.Styled.Html msg) -> Html.Styled.Html msg

values.name: success
values.type: Maybe.Maybe msg -> List.List (Html.Styled.Html msg) -> Html.Styled.Html msg

values.name: warning
values.type: Maybe.Maybe msg -> List.List (Html.Styled.Html msg) -> Html.Styled.Html msg

name: SE.Framework.OuterClick
comment:
More or less copied from <https://github.com/xarvh/elm-onclickoutside>

Explanation for relatedTarget: <https://stackoverflow.com/questions/42764494/blur-event-relatedtarget-returns-null>

How to use:

    import Html exposing (..)
    import Html.Attributes exposing (class)
    import SE.Framework.OuterClick

    type Msg
    = UserClickedOutsideOfFruitDropdown

    dropdownView =
    let
    onClickOutsideAttributes =
    SE.Framework.OuterClick.withId "fruit-dropdown" UserClickedOutsideOfFruitDropdown

            otherAttributes =
                [ class "generic-dropdown" ]

            allAttributes =
                onClickOutsideAttributes ++ otherAttributes
        in
            div
                allAttributes
                [ text "apples"
                , text "oranges"
                , text "pears"
                ]

@docs withId, succeedIfClickIsOutsideOfId

values.name: succeedIfClickIsOutsideOfId
values.comment:
This is a Json.Decoder that you can use to decode a DOM
[FocusEvent](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FocusEvent).
It will _fail_ if `event.relatedTarget` or any of its ancestors have the
given DOM id.
It will succeed otherwise.

values.name: withId
values.comment:
The first argument is the DOM id that you want to assign to the element.
The second argument is the message that you want to trigger when the user
clicks outside the element.
The function returns a list of Html.Attributes to apply to the element.
The attributes are `tabindex`, `id` and the `focusout` event handler.
This function is meant to cover most use cases, but if you need more control
on the attributes, you will have to use
[succeedIfClickIsOutsideOfId](#succeedIfClickIsOutsideOfId) instead.

name: SE.Framework.Section

values.name: section
values.comment:
Creates a styled section html tag in line with [Bulmas section](https://bulma.io/documentation/layout/section/).

    section [] [ text "I'm the text inside the section!" ] == "<section>I'm the text inside the section!</section>"
values.type: List.List (Html.Styled.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Styled.Html msg) -> Html.Styled.Html msg

name: SE.Framework.Table
comment:
Bulmas table element
see <https://bulma.io/documentation/elements/table/>

The table element has several helper functions to make it easy to create the table. The Elm arcitecture makes it possible to require each sub component (like a table head) and structure the code in a very developer friendly way.


# Unsupported features

  - .is-selected


# Definition

@docs table, Modifier


# Header, Body and Footer

@docs head, body, foot, row, cell, rightCell

unions.name: Modifier
unions.comment: All Bulma table modifiers are supported, including the currently undocumented MobileFriendly.

values.name: cell
values.comment: Renders th tag if created as a child to the `head` function, otherwise it renders a td tag
values.type: List.List (Html.Styled.Attribute msg) -> Html.Styled.Html msg -> SE.Framework.Table.Cell msg

values.name: rightCell
values.comment: Renders right aligned th tag if created as a child to the `head` function, otherwise it renders a right aligned td tag
values.type: List.List (Html.Styled.Attribute msg) -> Html.Styled.Html msg -> SE.Framework.Table.Cell msg

values.name: table
values.comment: The main container. It takes the modifiers, head and foot to begin with and the body at the end.
values.type: List.List SE.Framework.Table.Modifier -> SE.Framework.Table.Head msg -> SE.Framework.Table.Foot msg -> SE.Framework.Table.Body msg -> Html.Styled.Html msg

name: SE.Framework.Tabs

unions.name: Modifier
unions.comment: Only medium sized tabs are supported.

values.name: link
values.comment:
An active link is rendered as a blue link, non-active are rendered av dark text.

    link False "https://example.com/" [ text "Go to example.com" ]
values.type: SE.Framework.Tabs.IsActive -> String.String -> List.List (Html.Styled.Html msg) -> SE.Framework.Tabs.Link msg

values.name: tabs
values.comment: Currently, only the Medium size modifier is supported, no boxed, fullwidth or anything else.
values.type: List.List SE.Framework.Tabs.Modifier -> List.List (SE.Framework.Tabs.Link msg) -> Html.Styled.Html msg

name: SE.Framework.Tag

unions.name: TagModifier
unions.comment: Supported modifiers are colors (all colors are supported) and sizes

unions.name: TagsModifier
unions.comment: Tags can be attached using the Addons modifier

values.name: deleteTag
values.comment: The delete modifier is supported using this function.

values.name: tag
values.comment: Colors and sizes is supported modifiers, `rounded` also, there is no way to attach a delete button to a tag, use `tags [Addons]` with a regular `tag` and `deleteTag`.

values.name: tags
values.type: List.List SE.Framework.Tag.TagsModifier -> List.List (Html.Styled.Html msg) -> Html.Styled.Html msg

name: SE.Framework.Title
comment:
Bulma Title elements
see <https://bulma.io/documentation/elements/title/>

Only the title element is supported, not the subtitle

@docs title1, title2, title3, title4, title5, title6

name: SE.Framework.Utils

values.name: block
values.comment: Block class used by .field, p etc

values.name: desktop
values.comment: Media query that maps to @media screen and (min-width: $desktop)

values.name: extended
values.comment: Media query that maps to @media screen and (min-width: $extended)

values.name: fullhd
values.comment: Media query that maps to @media screen and (min-width: $fullhd)

values.name: onChange
values.comment: onChange event is used on select form elements

values.name: tablet
values.comment:
Media query that maps to @media screen and (min-width: $tablet)
TODO add support for print to this since Bulma has it

values.name: widescreen
values.comment: Media query that maps to @media screen and (min-width: $widescreen)
